attributes.action: Stop once and for all unsolicited SMS fraud in the UK
attributes.background: Shady companies are sending fraudulent unsolicited premium rate SMS text messages to mobile phone owners in the UK. These cost recipients up to £4.50 a message often resulting in huge bills to the victim as the fraud is likely to go unnoticed for long periods of time.
attributes.additional_details:
Find a detailed description of the issue here:

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3580058/Thousands-hit-4-50-time-scam-Customers-facing-bills-hundreds-pounds-texts-advertising-gaming-services-pornographic-content.html

This petition posits it should be a legal requirement for phone carriers to:

Not allow these services be activated on a customer’s account unless they have explicitly requested so (e.g. a representative of the carrier calls the customer to confirm activation of this service was indeed requested). If a carrier does not have this framework in place, they should not be allowed to operate premium SMS services at all.

attributes.action: Release the 2012 NHS reform risk Assessment.
attributes.background: In 2012, the Health Secretary vetoed the publication of the risk assessment relating to the changes introduced in the Health and Social Care Act. The Information Commissioner's office declared that in the circumstances this was unreasonable and requested they be released.
attributes.additional_details: This petition requests that said document is released in the name of transparency.  No law was implemented to allow the government to pursue its current restructuring of the NHS and a reorganisation was guaranteed to be "off the cards" by the prime minister.  The current government has no mandate to reorganise the NHS and create ACOs.  We request access to the risk assessment in order to see if this was predicted prior to the 2012 HaSCA and whether the current collapse of the NHS was preventable

attributes.action: Government facilitate a cross party group of MP’s to assess the needs of the NHS
attributes.background: Suggest political parties stop using the problems the NHS faces for political gain and to work together to improve it for patients and employees of the service. To co-operate with each other to find the best solutions to maintaining a sustainable high level of health care for everyone.
attributes.additional_details:
The group could analyse other successful health care schemes, their procedures, expenditure measured against results. Do hospital and GP procedures need to change?

Is the British health care system working so well that it only needs more funds? If so, how can further funds be raised without increasing the national debt? All of these questions will be more credible to all political parties if answered by a cross party group of MP’s.

attributes.action: Make the 26-30 railcard pilot available to more than just Greater Anglia users.
attributes.background: As a welcome resource for travelling millennials, the 26-30 railcard was announced in the Chancellor's budget on the 22 November 2017. However, it is currently ONLY being piloted in the Greater Anglia area of the United Kingdom. I urge the government to consider piloting this in more than one area.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, millennials are one of the demographic groups in the UK that are hardest hit in terms of affordability of living. With stagnant wages and rising inflation and for most, a thirst for wanderlust, the 26-30 railcard should've been available as soon as it was announced. Another pressure on millennials is that many commute to their workplaces as majority live with their parents as they are unable to afford a house of their own. I urge the government to pilot this railcard in other areas.

attributes.action: Cap train fares to coincide with the National Minimal Wage
attributes.background: Train fares have recently gone up by 1/3. This increase has resulted in the majority of hard working Britain's finding that they are paying more for their train journey then what they are being paid an hour.
attributes.additional_details: For example an individual over the age of 18 will pay £7.90 for a 22 minute train ride to work where they will be paid £5.60 for an hours of hard work. This results in a loss of over £2! This increase is barbaric and train fares should be capped in line with the National Minimal Wage to ensure everyone is able to access transport to work!

attributes.action: Provide PIP for ALL type 1 diabetics who make a claim
attributes.background: Type 1 diabetes falls under the definition of a disability under the Equality Act 2010, which defines a disability as ‘a physical or mental impairment that has a substantial long-term negative effect on a person’s ability to carry out normal day-to-day activities’. PIP should be awarded to all T1D

attributes.action: Ban Gambling Adverts Pre-Watershed
attributes.background:
This petition aims to get the government to introduce legislation to ban gambling adverts from being shown pre-watershed. 

Gambling is a huge problem in the UK, last year a Gambling Commission report finds more than 2 million people are addicted to gambling or at risk of developing a problem [1].
attributes.additional_details: [1] https://www.theguardian.com/society/2017/aug/24/problem-gamblers-uk-gambling-commission-report

attributes.action: An NHS follow up for those suffering from mental health
attributes.background: I want anyone with depression in their medical history, to have a home visit from a professional, regularly. Access to support groups in every town. To deliver anti-depressants to their home. To signpost them to charitable organizations available.
attributes.additional_details:
For those affected to have access to a free gym membership, healthy food delivered to their door and an annual trip to a concert/show/item of interest. A postal scheme whereby every month leaflets about mental health and how to get help are posted through every door in the United Kingdom and for these to be displayed in every room in every NHS service available to both the public and professionals.
It is said that 1 in 4 people currently suffer from depression in the United Kingdom alone, 6188 have taken their own lives in 2017. It is time to make a change.

attributes.action: Pay nursing students whilst on placement in University
attributes.background: Nursing students whilst in University work full time with the NHS. For some people, the money that they get from the NHS and their loan isn’t even enough to cover their rent and living costs.
attributes.additional_details: A lot of student nurses get depressed, anxiety and are over tired because they put so much hard work into their nursing degrees especially from all the placements including night shifts. A lot more get stressed because they physically can’t afford to live due to overpriced student housing and then money to live off for the whole year. There is also transport to think about for nurses going to placement. Student nurses feel like they’re ‘cheap labour’ for the NHS which is awful and upsetting.

attributes.action: End any form of Monarchy in the UK and end all payments to the Royal Family.
attributes.background: Considering the financial state of the UK and with costs being cut left, right and centre is it perhaps time we cut one of the largest expenses? The Queen receives a HUGE payment from the tax payers of the United Kingdom on top of profits made from her own private lands. Both in the millions.
attributes.additional_details:
The Royal Family spend millions on travel, renovations and many luxuries. These costs don't include the hiring of security, among other things such as Royal Weddings. 
https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2017/jun/27/queens-income-rises-to-82m-to-cover-cost-of-buckingham-palace-works
https://www.coventrytelegraph.net/news/coventry-news/how-much-royal-family-cost-14111218

attributes.action: Make ADHD part of the blue badge scheme
attributes.background: Autism and physical disabilities are included in the blue badge scheme but people don’t understand how hard it is to catch public transport and make your journey with an ADHD child!! When they have a set routine and you miss your bus ADHD is just a challenge as any other disability.
attributes.additional_details: I believe if ADHD children got accepted for a blue badge it would help a lot of families . Like less melt downs, less late trips or making shopping easier. Nothing is worse than having errands to do and your child is kicking off because you are 10 minutes late home and they have a certain routine.

attributes.action: Make food manufacturers include the potassium content and Phosphate on labels.
attributes.background: People with Heart/Renal problems need to be mindful of the food they are eating making sure they do not consume to much potassium and phosphate, however this information is largely unknown by the manufacture. This petition aims to make the food manufacturers make this information readily available.

attributes.action: Give students in unaffordable cities larger student loans for unaffordable rent.
attributes.background: Winchester, outside of London is the second most expensive place to live in the UK. House prices have increased by 59% since 2007 but student loans have been cut. Large numbers of students here spent their entire student loans on housing alone and it’s getting more and more unaffordable every year.
attributes.additional_details:
Minimum halls costs are £121 p/w to £146 p/w. 
Private housing costs roughly the same. 
There is a shortage of jobs for students who need to work to afford rent, food and necessities. A number of students work outside of Winchester to secure work. Other students choose to live in surrounding towns and cities for cheaper rent. 

https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/uk-least-affordable-cities-house-prices-london-oxford-a7606326.html

https://www.winchester.ac.uk/accommodation-and-winchester-life/accommodation/costs/ 

https://www.your-move.co.uk/estate-agent/winchester/find-property-for-rent

attributes.action: Establish 14th March as a public holiday
attributes.background: On the passing of Stephen Hawking establish a day on which to honour him and all the nation's mathematicians and scientists (eg Newton, Halley, Babbage, Lovelace, Somerville, Berners-Lee etc etc); to fall within UK Science Week; coinciding with Pi Day. .
attributes.additional_details: A public holiday to be observed on the 14th March, a day given to discussion, deliberation, display and development of science and to encourage involvement and understanding by all

attributes.action: To implement a fishery licence to shoot a maximum of 3 otters a year.
attributes.background:
The current growth rate and lack of food for the otter has ment many well stocked fisheries to now be under attack. 
The otter while understandably protected, has outgrown its surroundings and is now ruining livelihoods of a multi billion pound industry.
attributes.additional_details:
There is so many videos of otter damage to fish, birds and wild life something has to be done to protect, 
1. Fish stocks in rivers
2. Bird life on nature reserves and rivers 
3. Fishery livelihoods. 
The continuing release of otters since 1999 has grown.
Earsham 2006 149 otters released 
And many more have been released under the radar.  
Many expensive carp have fallen victim to the otter and has cost many fisheries thousands of pounds in otter fencing where allowed and replacement of fish.

attributes.action: ban homework
attributes.background:
i don't like homework, students don't like homework, teachers don't like homework, so why is homework a thing? we don't need it, so lets get rid of it!
it prevents social building of students, and increases the workload heavily on teachers. homework is bad for everyone, the recipient, and producer.
attributes.additional_details: i hate homework, so let's get rid of it

attributes.action: Government to fund a scheme for carers flying with a person with disabilities
attributes.background: I’m asking the government to look into possible concessions for carers who have to fly with disabled people,I understand it’s not a governmental problem it’s in it’s a commercial problem but surely there is something you can do
attributes.additional_details: These concessions are desperately needed for example  I flew to Australia in 2005 and because I’m 6’5 I’m unable to fly economy so I’m forced to fly business or first class, on this occasion I paid for first class seats but I had to provide a equal seat for my carer and the total cost for the flight was £13,000 surely you can see this is totally disgusting.  Just because I’m disabled that doesn’t mean I shouldn’t be able to go on holiday when I want

attributes.action: Stop firms from increasing subscription prices during a contract.
attributes.background: When customers sign up to mobile, broadband, landline or a TV contract there is always a clause that the company can increase their prices in line with inflation.  A contract price should remain the same throughout its duration. This unfair practice needs to stop.

attributes.action: Egg freezing free on the NHS for Fibroid Carriers.
attributes.background: 1 in 5 women over the age of 30 suffer Fibroids with the most common being in African American women. Most women with fibroids will not be infertile, but depending on the severity of the Fibroids, some women are left with a number of symptoms from sever periods and heavy bleeding to Hysterectomy.
attributes.additional_details: Pregnant in 2016, at first scan was i told i was suffering from Fibroids. This made pregnancy hard, leaving me with severe cramps and bleeding. Had no choice but to have a planned c section. 7 months after, i was hospitalized due to sever bleeding and dizziness, cramps and pain from the fibroids. 27 and ive had to start early menopause injections because of the bleeding and pain and told no choice but to have hysterectomy. NHS provides egg freezing for transgender but not for Fibroid sufferers.

attributes.action: Ban Plastic envelopes and Paper catalogues, where seller has e-mail details.
attributes.background: Having just received 5 "mail shots" in one postal delivery,from Internet retailers, they all went straight into recycling. Waste of plastic, paper, fuel and postage costs. All the Internet Retailers have my e-mail address and could just as easily have e-mailed their brochure saving all of the above.

attributes.action: Encourage greater use of driverless trains by TOCs across the UK rail network.
attributes.background: TOCs' greatest cost is the wages of train drivers. Driverless trains have existed in the UK for decades, yet only a minority of the network use them. Driverless trains would increase efficiencies, make TOCs profitable, reduce the need for government subsidy, and enable a reduction in ticket prices.
attributes.additional_details:
- Automated de/acceleration patters help energy recovery and savings, making trains more environmentally friendly
- Drivers are no longer involved in monotonous tasks of driving a train. Some can be re-qualified and deployed along the line, providing more customer service and fewer staff-less stations
- Average speed of the system can increase
- 32 cities globally use fully automated metro systems
- Ticket prices and govt subsidies are unnecessarily high due to extortionate drivers wages

attributes.action: Require that sheltered accommodation residents are checked daily
attributes.background: A very close friend was lying unconscious while she lived in sheltered accommodation. She was not checked on which means many elderly people are being left unconscious which may then result in death.
attributes.additional_details: My friend is still in intensive care.

attributes.action: Use the money needed to change the passport colour for the NHS and the homeless
attributes.background: The Prime Minister has just announced that after Brexit our passports will change colour. This seems completely unnecessary and the money and resources needed could be put to better use like helping our underfunded NHS and helping homeless people off the streets.

attributes.action: Condemn the military action against ethnic Kurds by Iran and Iraq.
attributes.background: After the decision by the people of Kurdistan for independence in a referendum, retaliatory force by the Iranian backed militia and the Iraqi army against Kurdish populations in Kirkuk have resulted in dispossession and ethnically motivated crime.

attributes.action: Put pressure on the Chinese Government over the treatment of Uyghur Muslims
attributes.background:
Reports have suggested that the chinese government has been placing Uyghur Muslims in “re-education” camps, forcing them to drink alcohol and consume pork, both against the Islamic faith. 

These camps are echoes of previous ethnic cleansing and there needs to be ample pressure on China.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.independent.co.uk/news/world/asia/china-re-education-muslims-ramadan-xinjiang-eat-pork-alcohol-communist-xi-jinping-a8357966.html%3famp

attributes.action: Scrap PSPOs that give authorities the power to displace or fine homeless people.
attributes.background: Despite updated Home Office guidance at the start of the year, which instructs councils not to target people for being homeless and sleeping rough, the Guardian has found over 50 local authorities with public space protection orders (PSPOs) in place
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2018/may/20/homeless-people-fined-imprisoned-pspo-england-wales
Homeless people are banned from town centres, routinely fined hundreds of pounds and even sent to prison for some repeat offenses. Local authorities in England and Wales have issued hundreds of fixed-penalty notices and pursued criminal convictions for “begging”, “persistent and aggressive begging” and “loitering” since being given strengthened powers to combat antisocial behaviour in 2014.

attributes.action: Remove prescription fees for those with mental health issues.
attributes.background: From our experience, many people suffering with mental health issues need a number of prescriptions, which are expensive. In particular those with bipolar have difficulty managing their money - it’s part of the illness. Bipolar is life threatening - their prescription should be free.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to park across/block a private driveway
attributes.background: It seems a large oversight that people have free will to deny people the use of their own driveways by parking across with no repercussions. I myself have had multiple incidents and I’m sure many other people have also and no legal right to get the car moved. I hope to get this changed.

attributes.action: Britain should apologize for forced conscription in her West African colonies.
attributes.background: During WWII, Her Majesty’s Government forcefully conscripted young men from the former British West African colonies of the Gold Coast (now Ghana), Nigeria, Sierra Leone and the Gambia to fight against the Axis powers. It is estimated that the West African colonies supplied over 240,000 soldiers.
attributes.additional_details:
They experienced racial, and other forms, of discrimination compared to British soldiers. Tens of thousands of West African troops were killed in action or died of disease. Their families received no support or financial recompense from the colonial administration. Many of those who survived returned home from the frontlines with combat-related Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) and received no support or financial recompense from the colonial administration.
Please visit www.westafricaapology.com for further details.

attributes.action: Standardizing the work week to 4 days with a 3 day weekend.
attributes.background:
Increased productivity for business (studies show that employees working a four-day work week are more productive and happier overall); 
Cutting child care issues and costs, health problems from work related stress and an overall healthier work life balance.

attributes.action: Lower car tax and fuel benefit for diesel company cars after this years tax hike
attributes.background: The company car has become a cash cow for the government over the last few years. Many field representatives earn modest salaries, and have job cars where they have no choice of  model, engine type, etc. I would like to see the system made more fair after this years massive increase in tax.

attributes.action: Make supermarkets supply a point in store to discard excessive packaging
attributes.background: Facility to remove excessive amount of packaging within the store. Force a change to packaging habits by supermarkets and prevent contamination of products to be recycled

attributes.action: Remove Chris Brown’s ban from the U.K. and allow him access to the country.
attributes.background: Global sensation and pop-culture figure, Chris Brown was publicly banned from entering the United Kingdom in 2009 following his domestic abuse and violent history towards then girlfriend, Rihanna. I believe that the ban should be lifted almost 10 years on so Brown can come and perform in the U.K.
attributes.additional_details: My knowledge from the Daily Mail and love for Chris Brown are my references.

attributes.action: Commemorate the life of Stephen Hawking with a day of national mourning.
attributes.background:
One of the greatest minds of his generation.
A national treasure.
Influential for years to come.

attributes.action: Ban TV alcohol advertising completely.
attributes.background:
There are far too many alcohol adverts on TV. Pretty much all of them glamourise alcohol use, making it seem like you'll have a more adventurous life by drinking.

Let's save our people, help alcoholics quit and reduce binge drinking, by banning alcohol advertising on TV completely!
attributes.additional_details:
We all know how much damage alcohol causes. Many thousands of people are hospitalised yearly due to the use (or OVER use) of alcohol.

It is a scourge on our young people, in whom we are now seeing record levels of binge drinking amongst teenagers and people in their early 20s. 

The Beer federation at one point put out a literal "Beer goes with everything" advert. Why is this OK?

NO MORE ENCOURAGEMENT OF DRINKING BY GLAMOURISING IT IN OUR TV ADVERTISING!

attributes.action: Removal of the traffic calming on the Northway Lane M5 flyover
attributes.background: Nearly every day there’s a near miss on the M5 Northway Lane bridge because of the traffic calming measures as people either ignore the give way and going too fast! People also can’t see over the brow! The local road safety team don’t want to know about the state of the counties roads or anything

attributes.action: Put retirement age back to 60 for females and 60 for men.
attributes.background: I am 58 years old. Working with all sorts of conditions: COPD; Glucoma; 2 bad discs; Arthritis. To try and get time off to see a doctor is almost impossible. Getting up is a struggle. But I am not entitled to disability as I can dress wash and feed myself. Everyday is a struggle.

attributes.action: Compulsory to not repay any Tax Credits overpayments until it's been disputed
attributes.background: So many people receive letters from tax credits about overpayments that have to be paid back before it can be disputed. We need to make it compulsory that all evidence and appeals are done before any repayments have to be set up.
attributes.additional_details: I personally have been in this situation and from speaking to a number of people that have also experienced this, it would seem that once tax credits have received repayments or some form of monthly repayment method then they are no longer interested at looking at any evidence to dispute an overpayment. Therefore people are left with debts that are incorrect and have to pay them all back because they don't think they have any other option.

attributes.action: Make funeral wishes legally binding documents.
attributes.background: Having worked in the care sector for a number of years I have been amazed to discover that a persons funeral wishes that they specified are not legally binding.
attributes.additional_details: Having worked in the care sector for a number of years I have been amazed to discover that a persons funeral wishes that they specified are not legally binding. It's ultimately it is for your executors or administrators (where there are no executors) to decide upon how your body is disposed of and your funeral conducted. This is not acceptable. Surely a person who leaves an estate has the right to choose how their funeral is conducted and how their body is disposed of.

attributes.action: To be allowed 500 words / 2 sides of notes to every GCSE exam.
attributes.background: As a GCSE student, me and other students feel it would be beneficial to let all students have at least 500 words or 2 sides of notes during a GCSE exam. As the exams should teach students knowledge on how to apply information and use it correctly and efficiently, and not to cram excess information.

attributes.action: Make the purchase and use of pepper spray and/or stun devices legal.
attributes.background: It is almost illegal to defend yourself in the UK. I think it is about time; especially considering current situation, that it changes. It should be legal to carry an item for the purpose of defence and the above items should be legalised, even if licensing is required.

attributes.action: Recognise a need for local and government financial support for carers under 18
attributes.background: There are about 700,000 young carers (under 18) in the UK. They provide everyday care and support to their parents and relatives that adults carers do. However, they are not entitled to a such support as adult carers are. It is time the government considers how best to support these children.

attributes.action: To also be seen as a breach of contact when a father doesn’t show up to contact
attributes.background: I have a child arrangement order in place with my ex partner which states I have to make my child  available for contact if I do not I am breaching the court order and can be fined or even imprisoned yet if he doesnt show the court don’t see that as a breach
attributes.additional_details: I feel it is only fair that if the court orders things in a child arrangement order and it must be abided by law by myself then also my ex partner should be treated the same in the event of repeatedly not bothering to show up especially with no explanation. I feel it is only fair in this day and age that both parties in the situation be treated/punished equally in the event of breaking contact which has been ordered by the court.

attributes.action: Grant my sick mum indefinite leave to remain
attributes.background: On 24/11/2017 my mum was detained at a IR centre and hastily removed from the UK giving us little time to prepare given her age. The NRC just sent her back without proper consultation or duty of care as to how she would be cared for once she is there, since her immediate family is here in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: My father was a political refugee following the 1980 elections in Jamaica, it was hard for mum as a single mother with little education. I migrated to the UK in 1997 to join my wife who was having our first child. My mum traveled back and forth to the UK for visits. When we were about to have our 3rd child in 2002, we decided that it was best for her to stay and that was the start of our struggles with the Home Office to get them to grant her indefinite leave to remain.

attributes.action: Restrict the public sale of fireworks to silent firework types
attributes.background: When it comes to Guy Fawkes night and New Years Eve the disturbance created by the sale of fireworks is extreme. The general public should only be able to purchase "silent fireworks" to limit the inconvenience they cause. Pets and people of nervous disposition experience terror during this time.
attributes.additional_details: My pet dog absolutely hates the time of year when Fireworks are let off, the sale of explosive fireworks should be banned and replaced with "silent fireworks" which are available on the Continent. This would allow people to enjoy the firework displays without disturbance to animals and people with young children. Restrict the sale of industrial strength explosive fireworks to licenced displays only

attributes.action: Persistent drunk drivers with 3 or more should be banned from driving for life.
attributes.background: Norfolk Police have arrested 57 people in 9 days for driving over the limit.
attributes.additional_details:
Too many people are repeat drink driving offenders.
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-24281043

Too many persistent offenders serve a short ban and are then able to reapply for their licences. For those who are clearly never going to learn we need the ultimate sanction. Fines and imprisonment are not enough. A lifetime driving ban will keep the roads safe for the vast majoriry of sensible drivers.

attributes.action: Change vaping law to hold more than 2 ml of liquid in any device
attributes.background: Vapes were made to hold only 2ml of juice making people carry bottles with them all the time. You carry bottles around with you, it’s stupid and makes no sense.

attributes.action: Hold an independent inquiry Health Service settlements
attributes.background: It has been reported that Virgin Care were handed almost £2 million in an out of court settlement by Surrey’s Clinical Commissioning Groups, NHS England and Surrey County Council in 2017. This is a gross misuse of public money, but no-one has resigned or been held accountable.
attributes.additional_details: Lessons deserve to be learnt from such losses of public money.

attributes.action: Legalise cannabis for medicinal purposes
attributes.background:
Evidence has shown that the use of CBD products improve help in cancer patients, people who suffer from severe epilepsy’s, MS and Parkinson’s desease
It’s time for action

attributes.action: Remove the Home Office exemption from the Data Protection Act
attributes.background: The Home Office has been given an exemption from GDPR and the data protection Act 2018. Citizens have a right to know what is being discussed with regard to their cases and an exemption puts us at risk of more scandals such as windrush.
attributes.additional_details: Citizens should not be denied the right to their data and further exclusions from society.
